articles.headline: For Mobile Messaging, GIFs Prove to Be Worth at Least a Thousand Words
articles.snippet: Animated, looping images are experiencing a surge on mobile devices, growing an industry and providing textless messages for millions of users.
articles.abstract: Animated, looping images are experiencing a surge on mobile devices, growing an industry and providing textless messages for millions of users.
articles.lead_paragraph: Lucy Dikeou, a 21-year-old senior at Stanford University, has long used English and the pictorial images known as emoji to text on her iPhone. A few months ago, she started messaging in a third language: GIFs.

articles.headline: Move to Fight Obama’s Climate Plan Started Early
articles.snippet: A group of lawyers, lobbyists and political strategists started devising a strategy for dismantling President Obama’s climate change regulations before he had even put forth a draft proposal.
articles.abstract: A group of lawyers, lobbyists and political strategists started devising a strategy for dismantling President Obama’s climate change regulations before he had even put forth a draft proposal.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In the early months of 2014, a group of about 30 corporate lawyers, coal lobbyists and Republican political strategists began meeting regularly in the headquarters of the U.S. Chamber of Commerce, often, according to some of the participants, in a conference room overlooking the White House. Their task was to start devising a legal strategy for dismantling the climate change regulations they feared were coming from President Obama.
articles.byline: By Coral Davenport and Julie Hirschfeld Davis

articles.headline: Puerto Rico Defaults on Bond Payment
articles.snippet: The Government Development Bank for Puerto Rico did not make a $58 million bond payment, saying it lacked the funds to meet the amount due.
articles.abstract: The Government Development Bank for Puerto Rico did not make a $58 million bond payment, saying it lacked the funds to meet the amount due.
articles.lead_paragraph: Puerto Rico defaulted on a $58 million bond payment on Monday, a risky move that seemed to intensify the pressure on creditors for broader debt renegotiation, but might also make future borrowing far more difficult.

articles.headline: Trans-Pacific Partnership Session Ends With Heels Dug In
articles.snippet: Disagreements over issues as varied as dairy, automobiles and pharmaceuticals are hampering final negotiations over the multinational trade pact.
articles.abstract: Disagreements over issues as varied as dairy, automobiles and pharmaceuticals are hampering final negotiations over the multinational trade pact.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Tokyo was ready to extend major concessions on American truck tariffs but was blocked by Mexico, which wanted less competition for its own trucks in the United States market.

articles.headline: Industrialist Heir to the Fiat Dynasty Charts His Course
articles.snippet: John Elkann clinches his biggest deal yet with the $6.9 billion acquisition of the insurer PartnerRe.
articles.abstract: John Elkann clinches his biggest deal yet with the $6.9 billion acquisition of the insurer PartnerRe.
articles.lead_paragraph: Takeover battles are often high drama, played out with heated words and outsize personalities.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: ISIS or Al Qaeda? American Officials Split Over Top Terror Threat
articles.snippet: Those who worry more about the Islamic State emphasize its recruiting power on social media; those more concerned with Qaeda affiliates warn of “mass casualty” attacks.
articles.abstract: Those who worry more about the Islamic State emphasize its recruiting power on social media; those more concerned with Qaeda affiliates warn of “mass casualty” attacks.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Obama administration’s top intelligence, counterterrorism and law enforcement officials are divided over which terrorist group poses the biggest threat to the American homeland, the Islamic State or Al Qaeda and its affiliates.

articles.headline: With Halo 5: Guardians, Microsoft Seeks to Lure E-Sports Players Back
articles.snippet: Microsoft is offering $1 million in prize money to competitive gamers, a crucial leg in the multimillion-dollar marketing push for the video game.
articles.abstract: Microsoft is offering $1 million in prize money to competitive gamers, a crucial leg in the multimillion-dollar marketing push for the video game.
articles.lead_paragraph: KIRKLAND, Wash. — A team of hundreds here was recently putting the final touches on a video game expected to be one of the biggest sellers of the holiday season.

articles.headline: An Old Songbook Could Put ‘Happy Birthday’ in the Public Domain
articles.snippet: A ruling is near in a lawsuit that claims the copyright on the much-sung song is not valid. That would be an unhappy day for Warner Music Group, which could lose millions in licensing fees.
articles.abstract: A ruling is near in a lawsuit that claims the copyright on the much-sung song is not valid. That would be an unhappy day for Warner Music Group, which could lose millions in licensing fees.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is one of the most beloved and famous of all songs, belted out at countless gatherings for infant and octogenarian alike. Yet “Happy Birthday to You,” far from being as free as a piece of cake at a party, is actually considered private property.
